description:
Everyone has their own fight, whether they know it or not. On Til This Day, broadcast journalist Radio Rahim travels through the most compelling life chapters of the greatest thinkers, artists and fighters of our time: from Questlove to Michael Che, Jon Stewart to Rosie Perez. Each guest shares how they earn their slice, find their opening, and, ultimately, prevail. 
New stories begin every Monday: Subscribe to Luminary, or learn more at: www.luminarypodcasts.com

image.title: Til This Day with Radio Rahim

items.content:
Nobody wants to say goodbye to Bob, but luckily, as Radio Rahim shares, we were able to have a bit more time with him, thanks to this three-chapter interview.*

In honor of Bob’s legacy of generosity, Luminary will match every gift made to the Bob Saget Memorial Fund through this page up to $10K* through August 31,2022, which will benefit the Scleroderma Research Foundation (SRF): https://support.srfcure.org/give/411758/#!/donation/checkout

items.title: Bob Saget: Epilogue

items.content:
Right Here, Right Now. “Bob could throw everything you intended to do out the window simply by reminding you to stay in the moment. So, out of respect for our friend, that’s what we're going to do… If we’re here with him, he’s still here with us.” –Radio Rahim

CREDITS
Executive Producers: Dave Chappelle, Radio Rahim, Noah Gersh, Jamie Schefman, Nick Panama, Kenzi Wilbur, Elliot O’Dea
Music & Sound Design: Eric Raichelson
Creative Producer: Alex Casnoff
Head of Production: Liz LeMay
Head of Engineering: Jordan Galvan
Production Manager: Allie Strobel
Post Coordinator: Alice Bearn
Edited by: Geoffrey Mutchnik
Mixed by: Zack Djurich
Additional Editing & Sound Design: Jasper van Dijk & Noah Kowalski
 
Til This Day is a Luminary Original Podcast in partnership with Pilot Boy Productions and SALT Audio.

items.title: Bob Saget: Ch 1

items.content:
At this point in the fight when the jabs starts working, and you find the right hand, you begin to define the pace. Questlove is about to find both hands working–and his footwork’s not bad either. Chapter 3: Yes Man.

CREDITS
Executive Producers: Dave Chappelle, Radio Rahim, Noah Gersh, Jamie Schefman, Nick Panama, Kenzi Wilbur, Elliot O’Dea
Music & Sound Design: SALT Audio

Edited by: Geoffrey Mutchnik
Mixed by: SALT Audio

Til This Day is a Luminary Original Podcast in partnership with Pilot Boy Productions and SALT Audio.

items.title: Questlove: Ch 3

ORG:
SALT Audio
Additional Editing & Sound Design

items.content:
They missed the train, but that wasn’t their train. Their train was bound for glory. Left in no man’s land, Questlove and Black Thought must find their roots. Chapter 2: Sprouting.

CREDITS
Executive Producers: Dave Chappelle, Radio Rahim, Noah Gersh, Jamie Schefman, Nick Panama, Kenzi Wilbur, Elliot O’Dea

items.title: Questlove: Ch 2

ORG:
SALT Audio
Additional Editing & Sound Design

items.content:
Son of doo-wop singer Lee Andrews, and the greatest hip-hop drummer of all time: Today we start the story of the Roots co-founder, Ahmir Khalib Thompson, aka Questlove. Chapter 1: Find the Opening.

CREDITS

items.title: Questlove: Ch 1

ORG:
SALT Audio
Additional Editing & Sound Design

items.content: Sports journalist Radio Rahim sits down with heavyweight guests, including Oscar-winner Questlove; Grammy, Emmy, and Mark Twain Prize-winner Jon Stewart; actress Rosie Perez; Saturday Night Live’s Michael Che, and more--for intimate, funny, and fascinating conversations about the metaphorical fight within all of us.
